001package org.jfree.chart.plot;
002
003
004import java.io.Serializable;
005
006public class ThermometerPlotProduct implements Serializable, Cloneable {
007        private double[][] subrangeInfo = { { 0.0, 50.0, 0.0, 50.0 }, { 50.0, 75.0, 50.0, 75.0 },
008                        { 75.0, 100.0, 75.0, 100.0 } };
009
010        public double[][] getSubrangeInfo() {
011                return subrangeInfo;
012        }
013
014        /**
015        * Sets the subrangeInfo attribute of the ThermometerPlot object
016        * @param range   the new rangeInfo value.
017        * @param rangeLow   the new rangeInfo value
018        * @param rangeHigh   the new rangeInfo value
019        * @param displayLow   the new rangeInfo value
020        * @param displayHigh   the new rangeInfo value
021        */
022        public void setSubrangeInfo(int range, double rangeLow, double rangeHigh, double displayLow, double displayHigh,
023                        ThermometerPlot thermometerPlot) {
024                if ((range >= 0) && (range < 3)) {
025                        setSubrange(range, rangeLow, rangeHigh);
026                        setDisplayRange(range, displayLow, displayHigh);
027                        thermometerPlot.setAxisRange();
028                        thermometerPlot.fireChangeEvent();
029                }
030        }
031
032        /**
033        * Sets the bounds for a subrange.
034        * @param range   the range type.
035        * @param low   the low value.
036        * @param high   the high value.
037        */
038        public void setSubrange(int range, double low, double high) {
039                if ((range >= 0) && (range < 3)) {
040                        this.subrangeInfo[range][ThermometerPlot.RANGE_HIGH] = high;
041                        this.subrangeInfo[range][ThermometerPlot.RANGE_LOW] = low;
042                }
043        }
044
045        /**
046        * Sets the displayed bounds for a sub range.
047        * @param range   the range type.
048        * @param low   the low value.
049        * @param high   the high value.
050        */
051        public void setDisplayRange(int range, double low, double high) {
052                if ((range >= 0) && (range < this.subrangeInfo.length) && ThermometerPlot.isValidNumber(high)
053                                && ThermometerPlot.isValidNumber(low)) {
054                        if (high > low) {
055                                this.subrangeInfo[range][ThermometerPlot.DISPLAY_HIGH] = high;
056                                this.subrangeInfo[range][ThermometerPlot.DISPLAY_LOW] = low;
057                        } else {
058                                this.subrangeInfo[range][ThermometerPlot.DISPLAY_HIGH] = low;
059                                this.subrangeInfo[range][ThermometerPlot.DISPLAY_LOW] = high;
060                        }
061                }
062        }
063
064        /**
065        * Returns true if the value is in the specified range, and false otherwise.
066        * @param subrange   the subrange.
067        * @param value   the value to check.
068        * @return  A boolean.
069        */
070        public boolean inSubrange(int subrange, double value) {
071                return (value > this.subrangeInfo[subrange][ThermometerPlot.RANGE_LOW]
072                                && value <= this.subrangeInfo[subrange][ThermometerPlot.RANGE_HIGH]);
073        }
074
075        public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
076                return (ThermometerPlotProduct) super.clone();
077        }
078}
